Free cash flow
Free cash flow is calculated as the sum of cash flows from operating activities less purchase of property, plant and equipment. A positive free cash flow shows that the Group is able to finance its activities and that external financing or capital raises is thus not necessary for the Group’s operating activities. There-fore, Executive Management believes that this non-IFRS liquidity measure provides useful information to investors in addition to the most directly comparable IFRS financial measure “Net cash flow from operat-ing activities.” The table below shows a reconciliation of free cash flow for 2021, 2020 and 2019:
